H0.text: The gravitational pull on the Moon is too low, so a person shouting in a deep valley on the Moon will not hear an echo reflected back off surrounding mountains, whereas in a similar valley on Earth the same shout produces an echo.

H1.text: The temperature on the Moon is too low, which is why no echo will be heard in a deep valley on the Moon, unlike in a similar valley on Earth where sound is reflected back off the surrounding mountains.

H2.text: There is no air on the Moon for the sound to travel through, so a person shouting in a deep valley on the Moon will not hear an echo, whereas on Earth the echo is heard as the sound is reflected back off the surrounding mountains.

H3.text: The mountains on the Moon cannot reflect sound, so a person shouting in a deep valley on the Moon will not hear an echo, unlike in a similar valley on Earth.

A4.text: Sound cannot travel through a vacuum.

A5.text: Sound requires a medium to propagate.
